keyword: how many calories in a chicken quesadilla at taco bell
title: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a chicken quesadilla at Taco Bell—about 510 kcal—plus full nutrition breakdown, macros, and tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla?
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla: flour tortilla, grilled chicken, three-cheese blend, creamy jalapeño sauce; no customizations.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, and customizations; values based on official Taco Bell data. Check app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: A Taco Bell chicken quesadilla contains about 510 calories with 27 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with Taco Bell's info.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Approximately 510 calories for one standard quesadilla.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a chicken quesadilla at Taco Bell?
faqs.a: About 27 g of protein per quesadilla.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Around 1240 mg of sodium, so watch portion if limiting salt.

faqs.q: Are carbs high in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Yes, about 40 g total carbs, including 3 g fiber from the tortilla.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie version at Taco Bell?
faqs.a: Opt for no sauce or fresco-style to reduce calories by 50–100 kcal.
